item.description:
OUR JUNE MEETUP!

Our next meetup is going to be in our Assistant Organizer's Sharon's back yard in Carver, MA. Don't miss a chance to take your Pug to play with all of his new found friends in Shar's yard - the Pugs can run so far they actually disappear in the distance, and it's completely fenced and mowed flat so that your wildly galloping Pug doesn't stub his toe on a dandelion. That yard is huge!

Okay, it's true, most of the Pugs sit around in a circle next to the folding chairs and wait for food to drop... but there is room to run. If you have the kind of Pug that sits on the window sill keeping an eye out for burglars and runs back and forth on the back of the couch barking at nothing, this is the venue for you. Your crazy Pug will sleep for hours when he gets home.

There is plenty of parking available. Please bring folding chairs. The group has grown big enough so that there probably won't be enough resident chairs to go around...

Goodies and fluids will be provided. DO NOT FEED CLOVIS! He has a damaged brain stem and has trouble swallowing. Imagine a Pug who has trouble swallowing! (Okay, you can feed him bits of soft food broken into tiny pieces... are you happy now, Clovis?)

Our next meetup is on the SECOND Sunday of June. See you then!


OUR LAST MEETUP...

The May 2007 meetup was postponed twice, once for Mother's Day, and once for rain, but when it finally arrived, it was a marvelous day, and a great time was had by all. Our 15 year old friend, Magic came to his second meetup, and despite Randall the rescue Pug's best efforts to annoy him, he had a good time hanging out with his new buddies.

We also had a brand new guest - and I mean brand new. He slept in his car seat during the entire meetup and never made a peep. He's going to grow up with Pug snorts in his dreams...

Buford the chubby Pug has faded away to normal size, thanks to Shar's strict diet regimen. Now Henry holds the title of Biggie Pug. Poor Buford! I feel for him!

Our meetups have grown to the point where I can't remember people's names anymore, and I'm even having trouble keeping the Pugs' names straight! So we went around the circle and shared names and Pugs - which explains the picture where Sharon is standing on the wall next to the deck and holding a Pug in the air... Of course, I promptly forgot everybody's name again. We'll have to do it again next time!

Maybe name tags??


ABOUT THE MEETUPS...

We're all responsible Pug owners here, so don't be concerned about your baby. Wherever we meet, we'll make sure to have shade and plenty of water for keeping Pugs cool. There will be biscuits for the dogs and soft drinks and something to snack on for the adults!

Other small dogs are welcome, but please ask in advance if you can bring dogs other than Pugs. If you have a little Puggie roughneck on your hands, you can bring him too - but be prepared to keep an eye on him. We want everyone to have fun.

Your organizer pays $19.95 per month for the privilege of organizing the South of Boston Pug Meetups, and believe me, it's worth every penny for the fun we have! If you would like to help defray the costs, make a voluntary contribution of $1.00 to Charlotte Creeley each time you attend. Remember, it's VOLUNTARY - even if I had to pay twice as much, it would be worth it for the just to see the smile on Clovis and Stoney's faces when Puggie Sunday rolls around.

If you are coming to your first meetup, please let us know, so we can introduce you to everyone and make you and your Puggies feel welcome!

group.name: The South of Boston Pug Meetup Group

item.name: The South of Boston Pug June Meetup
